sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 3, 5} and B = {2, 4}. Find (A⊕B) × B and B × (B⊕A), where ⊕ represents the symmetric difference. Show that (A⊕B) × B is not equal to B × (B⊕A), proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
